summary:
Thierry's career lays in agriculture and carbon sequestration. Thierry farmed for four years, designed and developed farming equipment for 11 years and coordinates and carry out agricultural research since 2019.
His interest and expertise is in sustainable farming systems and its practical implementation.
His focus and experience is in farming arable land producing feed and food while enhancing the soil. This last one can be anything from stopping erosion up to soil regeneration.
Would you like to know more or ask a question? Feel free to contact him for a chat around a cup of coffee.

profile_positions.description:
Agricultural soils are a limited resource and farming systems need to be at their optimal for tomorrow's challenges.  Within the Business Unit Agrosystems at Wageningen University and Research, Thierry works at developing solutions and practical knowledge to produce sufficiently and efficiently today while preparing soils and systems for our future needs.
In practice, Thierry searches and finds ways to conserve or regenerate soils while maintaining food production at the same level and similar costs. This allows farmer to maintain production and income today while preparing for a greener and healthier future.
If you have any interest or question, feel free to contact Thierry for a chat and a warm cup of coffee.
profile_positions.title: Agricultural soils and farming systems researcher

profile_positions.description:
Sharing knowledge with future managers and helping them to grow their skills is a nice contribution to our future. Thierry teaches for the course Conservation Agriculture and gives workshop about creativity.
 Within the first one, Thierry gives lectures, practicum, supports group work and helps with farm and field visits. This course is a minor at Wageningen University, both Bachelor and Master students take part to it and their backgrounds are very diverse. This mosaic in background and level requests to be clear, efficient and to the point while teaching the course.
 Secondly, Thierry gives a 2 days creativity workshop to Eng. D. students. They are highly skilled people who need to understand how creativity works and how to get the best out of it at both the individual and the group level.
profile_positions.title: University Teacher

profile_positions.description:
Agriculture faces challenges. While providing healthy food and other valuable products, it has to become greener, more efficient and answer societal requests. Within the Business Unit Agrosystems, Thierry works with farmers, companies and organizations to develop innovative tools and methods for the future. He works in many different projects, from long term robotic projects with a large team to One-On-One project with local farmer to enhance cover crop management and operations with short terms targets.
If you have any science or research needs for your new technology and the best way to use it on a farm, feel free to contact Thierry and, together with the WUR team, they will look at the best way to help you.
profile_positions.title: Precision Agriculture Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Soils is a limited resource. And, in 2050, the same (or less) fields will have to feed 9 billion peoples. Therefore human kind needs to take care of this asset and Conservation Agriculture is the answer to the question. Since 2015, Thierry has invested time and funds into developing better tools for Regenerative and Conservation Agriculture. He especially focused on crop establishment in no-tillage systems. To do so, Thierry used his engineering and scientist skills while developing new skills such as marketing, communication and costumer-development. Alongside the tool development, Thierry did some consultancy and training. For example, he trained engineers from a major tillage company to understand and know better the soil.
Since 2018, Thierry launched its first product: zip drill mark 1 which is a retrofit kit to be mounted on existing Monosem NG+ 4, NG+ M and John Deere Max Emerge precision seeders. This equipment allows to transform a conventional planter into a no-till planter. It creates an advanced seed slot with clean-seed-to-soil contact, fertilizer at 5cm (2inch from the seed) and a perfect closure.
If you have any needs in terms of no-tillage equipment for your planter, feel free to contact Thierry and he will look at the best solutions for your seeds and seedlings.
profile_positions.title: CEO and Tools designer for Regenerative/Conservation Agriculture

profile_positions.description: Kuhn is a large industrial group specialized in farm equipment. Thierry was a designer, engineer and researcher inside the Large Square Baler team. He mainly worked on the development of practical solutions for user problems, the validation of new technology and their integration in the manufacturing process.
profile_positions.title: Research and Development Engineer

profile_positions.description: The Cross Slot technology is produced and marketed by Baker No-Tillage Ltd and is a spin-off of Massey University in New Zealand. At the head-quarter in New Zealand, Thierry was in charge of the development of the single seed system for Cross Slot new product range: a planter row-unit. The project required innovative thinking, rapid prototyping, setting up protocols, testing and data treatment. Beside the development of this precision metering system, Thierry defined the BNT drawing standards for overseas manufacturing (manufacturing in the USA for example), designed frames and helped in different engineering projects. Thierry was also in charge to communicate with Spanish and South American farmers interested by the Cross Slot technology.
profile_positions.title: Research and Development Scientist

profile_positions.company: PDL Laboratorio de Diseño de Producto de la Escuela de Ingeniería de Bilbao (UPV/EHU)
profile_positions.description: The PDL is a university laboratorium where new design technologies and methods are developed. Thierry worked on reverse engineering. He tested, assessed and compared 2 different softwares to treat a point cloud (obtained from a 3D scan) to obtain clear meshes and useful geometric object (hole axis for example). Eventually, he measured the deviations of the final mesh with the original point cloud. The result of the project was a better knowledge of the potential of both software. Thierry did his final report and presentation in Spanish.
profile_positions.title: software assessment trainee

profile_positions.description: Irrifrance is an irrigation equipment manufacturer and they offer a wide range of solution to the farmers. Thierry worked at the engineering office on the smallest turbine which had a performance issue. The turbine only yielded from 30 to 50 % . He was in charge to find out the issue, understand it and solve the problem. Thierry found the issue and understood it. He started to work on a solution but due to lack of time, he didn't test it. The project was carried over to a second student which started the same week Thierry completed his contract.
profile_positions.title: Turbine Research and Development Trainee

profile_positions.description: Liebherr is a large industrial group with a site dedicated to large hydraulics excavators. Thierry worked inside the manufacturing management team and worked on the optimization of a numbers of tools. To assemble excavators from 125 tons up to 800 tons, operators use complex and rare tools. Those specifics tools were shared between the 3 assemble lines and within the lines themselves. Thierry mission was to identify tools issues which affect productivity and propose solutions which enhance productivity meanwhile minimizing costs.
profile_positions.title: Tooling and process trainee

profile_positions.description: "Groupement d'employeurs Projoba" is an association created by 3 farmers so they could hire a crop manager and share the cost. Thierry was the first crop manager hired by the farmers. Thierry was in charge of soil preparation, crop establishment and crop growth-and-health as well as machinery, drains and general farm maintenance when work load was reduced. The crops were: wheat, corn, sunflower, soybeans, Oil Seed Rape, alfa alfa, oats and cover crops. The cropped area was 520 ha divided in 46 fields.
profile_positions.title: Crop Manager

profile_positions.description: Meringo Holdings is a sheep-and-grain farm in Western Australia and the owners, John and Marilyn Hart, hired and hosted young foreigners part of an exchange program. Thierry worked and spent 8 months with the Hart family which included the 2 busiest periods of the year: seeding and harvesting. Thierry operated machinery, did sheep work and did some farm development work after the farm was expended from 2500 to 4500 ha in a single operation.
profile_positions.title: Farm operator

company.name: SYNDICAT DES PRODUCTEURS DE LEGUMES DE LA HAUTE LANDE

profile_positions.company: SYNDICAT DES PRODUCTEURS DE LEGUMES DE LA HAUTE LANDE
profile_positions.description: The "Syndicat des Producteurs de Légumes de la Haute Lande" was an association of 6 farmers and industrials which decided to work together to optimize their carrots crop and marketing. This association represented 25% of all carrots produced in France. Thierry worked inside the agronomist team. He worked on carrot nitrogen use, on varieties and on fungicides programs. This experience was part of Thierry agronomist degree. He wrote and presented findings about the best strategy against Alternaria Dauci, a leaf disease in carrots.
profile_positions.title: carrots research and consultancy trainee
